What is an Interface in Java?In Java, an interface is a contract that defines a set of abstract methods. It tells what a class must do, but not how to do it.✅ Helps achieve abstraction ✅ Supports multiple inheritance in Java ✅ Improves loose coupling between componentsReal-world example: Think of an interface as a remote control. Role: Java Developer Location: RemoteDuration: Long Term ContractJob Description:Client is looking for Java Senior Engineer to build end to end business solutions and to work with one of the leading financial services organizations in the US. The candidate must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with domain experts and technical experts in the team. The candidate must have experience in analysis, design, development, maintenance, and support activities. Responsibilities: • Review technology requirements and business processes; code, test, debug, and implement software solutions. • Provide engineering support in the conceptualization, development, implementation, and automation of technical capabilities and products. • Write and implement efficient, maintainable code across both front-end and back-end technologies. • Perform peer reviews on source code to ensure reuse, scalability, and the use of best practices. • Participate in collaborative technical discussions focusing on software user experience, design, architecture, and development. • Perform demonstrations for client stakeholders on project features and sub-features, utilizing the latest front-end and back-end development technologies. • Provide production support, troubleshoot production issues, analyze the root cause of the issues, and implement fixes. • Analyze user needs and software requirements to determine feasibility of design within time and cost constraints. • Confer with other systems analysts, engineers, programmers, and others to design systems and obtain information on project limitations and capabilities, performance requirements, and interfaces. • Store, retrieve, and manipulate data for analysis of system capabilities and requirements. • Conduct technical reviews with other programmers, technologists, technicians, and other engineering and scientific personnel. • Coordinate software system installation and monitor equipment functioning to ensure specifications are met. • Consult with customers about software system design and maintenance.• Report any issues to client stakeholders and UST leadership. Requirements: • BS degree or higher in Computer Science or related technical field involving coding. • 14+ years of experience in designing and developing full-stack applications using Java/J2EE, Spring Boot, and React.js. • Strong experience with front-end UI technologies, including JavaScript, React, jQuery, AJAX, JSON, HTML, and CSS. • Strong background in Data Engineering and building data platforms. • Knowledge of messaging systems like Kafka. • A solid understanding of security practices. • Experience in unit and automation testing (Jasmine, Protractor, JUnit). • Experience with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins.Sumit SharmaWhatsapp: +1-971-7080-789Sumit.Sharma@metasisinfo.com

The candidate must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with domain experts and technical experts in the team. The candidate must have experience in analysis, design, development, maintenance, and support activities. Responsibilities: • Review technology requirements and business processes; code, test, debug, and implement software solutions. • Provide engineering support in the conceptualization, development, implementation, and automation of technical capabilities and products. • Write and implement efficient, maintainable code across both front-end and back-end technologies. • Perform peer reviews on source code to ensure reuse, scalability, and the use of best practices. • Participate in collaborative technical discussions focusing on software user experience, design, architecture, and development. • Perform demonstrations for client stakeholders on project features and sub-features, utilizing the latest front-end and back-end development technologies. • Provide production support, troubleshoot production issues, analyze the root cause of the issues, and implement fixes. • Analyze user needs and software requirements to determine feasibility of design within time and cost constraints. • Confer with other systems analysts, engineers, programmers, and others to design systems and obtain information on project limitations and capabilities, performance requirements, and interfaces. • Store, retrieve, and manipulate data for analysis of system capabilities and requirements. • Conduct technical reviews with other programmers, technologists, technicians, and other engineering and scientific personnel. • Coordinate software system installation and monitor equipment functioning to ensure specifications are met. • Consult with customers about software system design and maintenance.• Report any issues to client stakeholders and UST leadership. Requirements: • BS degree or higher in Computer Science or related technical field involving coding. • 14+ years of experience in designing and developing full-stack applications using Java/J2EE, Spring Boot, and React.js. • Strong experience with front-end UI technologies, including JavaScript, React, jQuery, AJAX, JSON, HTML, and CSS. • Strong background in Data Engineering and building data platforms. • Knowledge of messaging systems like Kafka. • A solid understanding of security practices. • Experience in unit and automation testing (Jasmine, Protractor, JUnit). • Experience with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins.Sumit SharmaWhatsapp: +1-971-7080-789Sumit.Sharma@metasisinfo.com

Role: Java Developer Location: RemoteDuration: Long Term ContractJob Description:Client is looking for Java Senior Engineer to build end to end business solutions and to work with one of the leading financial services organizations in the US. The candidate must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with domain experts and technical experts in the team. The candidate must have experience in analysis, design, development, maintenance, and support activities. Responsibilities: • Review technology requirements and business processes; code, test, debug, and implement software solutions. • Provide engineering support in the conceptualization, development, implementation, and automation of technical capabilities and products. • Write and implement efficient, maintainable code across both front-end and back-end technologies. • Perform peer reviews on source code to ensure reuse, scalability, and the use of best practices. • Participate in collaborative technical discussions focusing on software user experience, design, architecture, and development. • Perform demonstrations for client stakeholders on project features and sub-features, utilizing the latest front-end and back-end development technologies. • Provide production support, troubleshoot production issues, analyze the root cause of the issues, and implement fixes. • Analyze user needs and software requirements to determine feasibility of design within time and cost constraints. • Confer with other systems analysts, engineers, programmers, and others to design systems and obtain information on project limitations and capabilities, performance requirements, and interfaces. • Store, retrieve, and manipulate data for analysis of system capabilities and requirements. • Conduct technical reviews with other programmers, technologists, technicians, and other engineering and scientific personnel. • Coordinate software system installation and monitor equipment functioning to ensure specifications are met. • Consult with customers about software system design and maintenance.• Report any issues to client stakeholders and UST leadership. Requirements: • BS degree or higher in Computer Science or related technical field involving coding. • 14+ years of experience in designing and developing full-stack applications using Java/J2EE, Spring Boot, and React.js. • Strong experience with front-end UI technologies, including JavaScript, React, jQuery, AJAX, JSON, HTML, and CSS. • Strong background in Data Engineering and building data platforms. • Knowledge of messaging systems like Kafka. • A solid understanding of security practices. • Experience in unit and automation testing (Jasmine, Protractor, JUnit). • Experience with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins.Sumit SharmaWhatsapp: +1-971-7080-789Sumit.Sharma@metasisinfo.com

What is an Interface in Java?In Java, an interface is a contract that defines a set of abstract methods. It tells what a class must do, but not how to do it.✅ Helps achieve abstraction ✅ Supports multiple inheritance in Java ✅ Improves loose coupling between componentsReal-world example: Think of an interface as a remote control. Different brands of TVs implement the same basic functions—power on/off, volume control—but how they work internally is different.hashtag#Java hashtag#JavaInterface hashtag#InterfaceInJava hashtag#JavaConcepts hashtag#LearnJava hashtag#JavaLearning hashtag#CodingCommunity hashtag#JavaDeveloper hashtag#BackendDevelopment hashtag#SpringBoot hashtag#Microservices hashtag#TechTalk hashtag#TechCommunity hashtag#ProgrammersLife hashtag#CodeNewbie hashtag#WomenWhoCode hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareEngineer hashtag#100DaysOfCode hashtag#CleanCode hashtag#ObjectOrientedProgramming hashtag#JavaBackend hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#API hashtag#DesignPatterns

What is an Interface in Java?In Java, an interface is a contract that defines a set of abstract methods. It tells what a class must do, but not how to do it.✅ Helps achieve abstraction ✅ Supports multiple inheritance in Java ✅ Improves loose coupling between componentsReal-world example: Think of an interface as a remote control. What is an Interface in Java?In Java, an interface is a contract that defines a set of abstract methods. It tells what a class must do, but not how to do it.✅ Helps achieve abstraction ✅ Supports multiple inheritance in Java ✅ Improves loose coupling between componentsReal-world example: Think of an interface as a remote control. What is an Interface in Java?In Java, an interface is a contract that defines a set of abstract methods. It tells what a class must do, but not how to do it.✅ Helps achieve abstraction ✅ Supports multiple inheritance in Java ✅ Improves loose coupling between componentsReal-world example: Think of an interface as a remote control. Different brands of TVs implement the same basic functions—power on/off, volume control—but how they work internally is different.hashtag#Java hashtag#JavaInterface hashtag#InterfaceInJava hashtag#JavaConcepts hashtag#LearnJava hashtag#JavaLearning hashtag#CodingCommunity hashtag#JavaDeveloper hashtag#BackendDevelopment hashtag#SpringBoot hashtag#Microservices hashtag#TechTalk hashtag#TechCommunity hashtag#ProgrammersLife hashtag#CodeNewbie hashtag#WomenWhoCode hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareEngineer hashtag#100DaysOfCode hashtag#CleanCode hashtag#ObjectOrientedProgramming hashtag#JavaBackend hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#API hashtag#DesignPatterns

What is an Interface in Java?In Java, an interface is a contract that defines a set of abstract methods. It tells what a class must do, but not how to do it.✅ Helps achieve abstraction ✅ Supports multiple inheritance in Java ✅ Improves loose coupling between componentsReal-world example: Think of an interface as a remote control. Different brands of TVs implement the same basic functions—power on/off, volume control—but how they work internally is different.hashtag#Java hashtag#JavaInterface hashtag#InterfaceInJava hashtag#JavaConcepts hashtag#LearnJava hashtag#JavaLearning hashtag#CodingCommunity hashtag#JavaDeveloper hashtag#BackendDevelopment hashtag#SpringBoot hashtag#Microservices hashtag#TechTalk hashtag#TechCommunity hashtag#ProgrammersLife hashtag#CodeNewbie hashtag#WomenWhoCode hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareEngineer hashtag#100DaysOfCode hashtag#CleanCode hashtag#ObjectOrientedProgramming hashtag#JavaBackend hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#API hashtag#DesignPatterns

What is an Interface in Java?In Java, an interface is a contract that defines a set of abstract methods. It tells what a class must do, but not how to do it.✅ Helps achieve abstraction ✅ Supports multiple inheritance in Java ✅ Improves loose coupling between componentsReal-world example: Think of an interface as a remote control. Different brands of TVs implement the same basic functions—power on/off, volume control—but how they work internally is different.hashtag#Java hashtag#JavaInterface hashtag#InterfaceInJava hashtag#JavaConcepts hashtag#LearnJava hashtag#JavaLearning hashtag#CodingCommunity hashtag#JavaDeveloper hashtag#BackendDevelopment hashtag#SpringBoot hashtag#Microservices hashtag#TechTalk hashtag#TechCommunity hashtag#ProgrammersLife hashtag#CodeNewbie hashtag#WomenWhoCode hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareEngineer hashtag#100DaysOfCode hashtag#CleanCode hashtag#ObjectOrientedProgramming hashtag#JavaBackend hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#API hashtag#DesignPatterns

The candidate must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with domain experts and technical experts in the team. Requirements: • BS degree or higher in Computer Science or related technical field involving coding. • 14+ years of experience in designing and developing full-stack applications using Java/J2EE, Spring Boot, and React.js. • Strong experience with front-end UI technologies, including JavaScript, React, jQuery, AJAX, JSON, HTML, and CSS. • Strong background in Data Engineering and building data platforms. • Knowledge of messaging systems like Kafka. • A solid understanding of security practices. • Experience in unit and automation testing (Jasmine, Protractor, JUnit). • Experience with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins.Sumit SharmaWhatsapp: +1-971-7080-789Sumit.Sharma@metasisinfo.com

What is an Interface in Java?In Java, an interface is a contract that defines a set of abstract methods. It tells what a class must do, but not how to do it.✅ Helps achieve abstraction ✅ Supports multiple inheritance in Java ✅ Improves loose coupling between componentsReal-world example: Think of an interface as a remote control. Different brands of TVs implement the same basic functions—power on/off, volume control—but how they work internally is different.hashtag#Java hashtag#JavaInterface hashtag#InterfaceInJava hashtag#JavaConcepts hashtag#LearnJava hashtag#JavaLearning hashtag#CodingCommunity hashtag#JavaDeveloper hashtag#BackendDevelopment hashtag#SpringBoot hashtag#Microservices hashtag#TechTalk hashtag#TechCommunity hashtag#ProgrammersLife hashtag#CodeNewbie hashtag#WomenWhoCode hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareEngineer hashtag#100DaysOfCode hashtag#CleanCode hashtag#ObjectOrientedProgramming hashtag#JavaBackend hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#API hashtag#DesignPatterns

What is an Interface in Java?In Java, an interface is a contract that defines a set of abstract methods. It tells what a class must do, but not how to do it.✅ Helps achieve abstraction ✅ Supports multiple inheritance in Java ✅ Improves loose coupling between componentsReal-world example: Think of an interface as a remote control. Different brands of TVs implement the same basic functions—power on/off, volume control—but how they work internally is different.hashtag#Java hashtag#JavaInterface hashtag#InterfaceInJava hashtag#JavaConcepts hashtag#LearnJava hashtag#JavaLearning hashtag#CodingCommunity hashtag#JavaDeveloper hashtag#BackendDevelopment hashtag#SpringBoot hashtag#Microservices hashtag#TechTalk hashtag#TechCommunity hashtag#ProgrammersLife hashtag#CodeNewbie hashtag#WomenWhoCode hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareEngineer hashtag#100DaysOfCode hashtag#CleanCode hashtag#ObjectOrientedProgramming hashtag#JavaBackend hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#API hashtag#DesignPatterns

The candidate must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with domain experts and technical experts in the team. Requirements: • BS degree or higher in Computer Science or related technical field involving coding. • 14+ years of experience in designing and developing full-stack applications using Java/J2EE, Spring Boot, and React.js. • Strong experience with front-end UI technologies, including JavaScript, React, jQuery, AJAX, JSON, HTML, and CSS. • Strong background in Data Engineering and building data platforms. • Knowledge of messaging systems like Kafka. • A solid understanding of security practices. • Experience in unit and automation testing (Jasmine, Protractor, JUnit). • Experience with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins.Sumit SharmaWhatsapp: +1-971-7080-789Sumit.Sharma@metasisinfo.com

What is an Interface in Java?In Java, an interface is a contract that defines a set of abstract methods. It tells what a class must do, but not how to do it.✅ Helps achieve abstraction ✅ Supports multiple inheritance in Java ✅ Improves loose coupling between componentsReal-world example: Think of an interface as a remote control. Different brands of TVs implement the same basic functions—power on/off, volume control—but how they work internally is different.hashtag#Java hashtag#JavaInterface hashtag#InterfaceInJava hashtag#JavaConcepts hashtag#LearnJava hashtag#JavaLearning hashtag#CodingCommunity hashtag#JavaDeveloper hashtag#BackendDevelopment hashtag#SpringBoot hashtag#Microservices hashtag#TechTalk hashtag#TechCommunity hashtag#ProgrammersLife hashtag#CodeNewbie hashtag#WomenWhoCode hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareEngineer hashtag#100DaysOfCode hashtag#CleanCode hashtag#ObjectOrientedProgramming hashtag#JavaBackend hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#API hashtag#DesignPatterns

What is an Interface in Java?In Java, an interface is a contract that defines a set of abstract methods. It tells what a class must do, but not how to do it.✅ Helps achieve abstraction ✅ Supports multiple inheritance in Java ✅ Improves loose coupling between componentsReal-world example: Think of an interface as a remote control. Different brands of TVs implement the same basic functions—power on/off, volume control—but how they work internally is different.hashtag#Java hashtag#JavaInterface hashtag#InterfaceInJava hashtag#JavaConcepts hashtag#LearnJava hashtag#JavaLearning hashtag#CodingCommunity hashtag#JavaDeveloper hashtag#BackendDevelopment hashtag#SpringBoot hashtag#Microservices hashtag#TechTalk hashtag#TechCommunity hashtag#ProgrammersLife hashtag#CodeNewbie hashtag#WomenWhoCode hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareEngineer hashtag#100DaysOfCode hashtag#CleanCode hashtag#ObjectOrientedProgramming hashtag#JavaBackend hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#API hashtag#DesignPatterns

Role: Java Developer Location: RemoteDuration: Long Term ContractJob Description:Client is looking for Java Senior Engineer to build end to end business solutions and to work with one of the leading financial services organizations in the US. The candidate must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with domain experts and technical experts in the team. The candidate must have experience in analysis, design, development, maintenance, and support activities. Responsibilities: • Review technology requirements and business processes; code, test, debug, and implement software solutions. • Provide engineering support in the conceptualization, development, implementation, and automation of technical capabilities and products. • Write and implement efficient, maintainable code across both front-end and back-end technologies. • Perform peer reviews on source code to ensure reuse, scalability, and the use of best practices. • Participate in collaborative technical discussions focusing on software user experience, design, architecture, and development. • Perform demonstrations for client stakeholders on project features and sub-features, utilizing the latest front-end and back-end development technologies. • Provide production support, troubleshoot production issues, analyze the root cause of the issues, and implement fixes. • Analyze user needs and software requirements to determine feasibility of design within time and cost constraints. • Confer with other systems analysts, engineers, programmers, and others to design systems and obtain information on project limitations and capabilities, performance requirements, and interfaces. • Store, retrieve, and manipulate data for analysis of system capabilities and requirements. • Conduct technical reviews with other programmers, technologists, technicians, and other engineering and scientific personnel. • Coordinate software system installation and monitor equipment functioning to ensure specifications are met. • Consult with customers about software system design and maintenance.• Report any issues to client stakeholders and UST leadership. Requirements: • BS degree or higher in Computer Science or related technical field involving coding. • 14+ years of experience in designing and developing full-stack applications using Java/J2EE, Spring Boot, and React.js. • Strong experience with front-end UI technologies, including JavaScript, React, jQuery, AJAX, JSON, HTML, and CSS. • Strong background in Data Engineering and building data platforms. • Knowledge of messaging systems like Kafka. • A solid understanding of security practices. • Experience in unit and automation testing (Jasmine, Protractor, JUnit). • Experience with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins.Sumit SharmaWhatsapp: +1-971-7080-789Sumit.Sharma@metasisinfo.com

What is an Interface in Java?In Java, an interface is a contract that defines a set of abstract methods. It tells what a class must do, but not how to do it.✅ Helps achieve abstraction ✅ Supports multiple inheritance in Java ✅ Improves loose coupling between componentsReal-world example: Think of an interface as a remote control. Different brands of TVs implement the same basic functions—power on/off, volume control—but how they work internally is different.hashtag#Java hashtag#JavaInterface hashtag#InterfaceInJava hashtag#JavaConcepts hashtag#LearnJava hashtag#JavaLearning hashtag#CodingCommunity hashtag#JavaDeveloper hashtag#BackendDevelopment hashtag#SpringBoot hashtag#Microservices hashtag#TechTalk hashtag#TechCommunity hashtag#ProgrammersLife hashtag#CodeNewbie hashtag#WomenWhoCode hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareEngineer hashtag#100DaysOfCode hashtag#CleanCode hashtag#ObjectOrientedProgramming hashtag#JavaBackend hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#API hashtag#DesignPatterns

What is an Interface in Java?In Java, an interface is a contract that defines a set of abstract methods. It tells what a class must do, but not how to do it.✅ Helps achieve abstraction ✅ Supports multiple inheritance in Java ✅ Improves loose coupling between componentsReal-world example: Think of an interface as a remote control. What is an Interface in Java?In Java, an interface is a contract that defines a set of abstract methods. It tells what a class must do, but not how to do it.✅ Helps achieve abstraction ✅ Supports multiple inheritance in Java ✅ Improves loose coupling between componentsReal-world example: Think of an interface as a remote control. Different brands of TVs implement the same basic functions—power on/off, volume control—but how they work internally is different.hashtag#Java hashtag#JavaInterface hashtag#InterfaceInJava hashtag#JavaConcepts hashtag#LearnJava hashtag#JavaLearning hashtag#CodingCommunity hashtag#JavaDeveloper hashtag#BackendDevelopment hashtag#SpringBoot hashtag#Microservices hashtag#TechTalk hashtag#TechCommunity hashtag#ProgrammersLife hashtag#CodeNewbie hashtag#WomenWhoCode hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareEngineer hashtag#100DaysOfCode hashtag#CleanCode hashtag#ObjectOrientedProgramming hashtag#JavaBackend hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#API hashtag#DesignPatterns

Role: Java Developer Location: RemoteDuration: Long Term ContractJob Description:Client is looking for Java Senior Engineer to build end to end business solutions and to work with one of the leading financial services organizations in the US. The candidate must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with domain experts and technical experts in the team. The candidate must have experience in analysis, design, development, maintenance, and support activities. Responsibilities: • Review technology requirements and business processes; code, test, debug, and implement software solutions. • Provide engineering support in the conceptualization, development, implementation, and automation of technical capabilities and products. • Write and implement efficient, maintainable code across both front-end and back-end technologies. • Perform peer reviews on source code to ensure reuse, scalability, and the use of best practices. • Participate in collaborative technical discussions focusing on software user experience, design, architecture, and development. • Perform demonstrations for client stakeholders on project features and sub-features, utilizing the latest front-end and back-end development technologies. • Provide production support, troubleshoot production issues, analyze the root cause of the issues, and implement fixes. • Analyze user needs and software requirements to determine feasibility of design within time and cost constraints. • Confer with other systems analysts, engineers, programmers, and others to design systems and obtain information on project limitations and capabilities, performance requirements, and interfaces. • Store, retrieve, and manipulate data for analysis of system capabilities and requirements. • Conduct technical reviews with other programmers, technologists, technicians, and other engineering and scientific personnel. • Coordinate software system installation and monitor equipment functioning to ensure specifications are met. • Consult with customers about software system design and maintenance.• Report any issues to client stakeholders and UST leadership. Requirements: • BS degree or higher in Computer Science or related technical field involving coding. • 14+ years of experience in designing and developing full-stack applications using Java/J2EE, Spring Boot, and React.js. • Strong experience with front-end UI technologies, including JavaScript, React, jQuery, AJAX, JSON, HTML, and CSS. • Strong background in Data Engineering and building data platforms. • Knowledge of messaging systems like Kafka. • A solid understanding of security practices. • Experience in unit and automation testing (Jasmine, Protractor, JUnit). • Experience with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins.Sumit SharmaWhatsapp: +1-971-7080-789Sumit.Sharma@metasisinfo.com

What is an Interface in Java?In Java, an interface is a contract that defines a set of abstract methods. It tells what a class must do, but not how to do it.✅ Helps achieve abstraction ✅ Supports multiple inheritance in Java ✅ Improves loose coupling between componentsReal-world example: Think of an interface as a remote control. Different brands of TVs implement the same basic functions—power on/off, volume control—but how they work internally is different.hashtag#Java hashtag#JavaInterface hashtag#InterfaceInJava hashtag#JavaConcepts hashtag#LearnJava hashtag#JavaLearning hashtag#CodingCommunity hashtag#JavaDeveloper hashtag#BackendDevelopment hashtag#SpringBoot hashtag#Microservices hashtag#TechTalk hashtag#TechCommunity hashtag#ProgrammersLife hashtag#CodeNewbie hashtag#WomenWhoCode hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareEngineer hashtag#100DaysOfCode hashtag#CleanCode hashtag#ObjectOrientedProgramming hashtag#JavaBackend hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#API hashtag#DesignPatterns

What is an Interface in Java?In Java, an interface is a contract that defines a set of abstract methods. It tells what a class must do, but not how to do it.✅ Helps achieve abstraction ✅ Supports multiple inheritance in Java ✅ Improves loose coupling between componentsReal-world example: Think of an interface as a remote control. Different brands of TVs implement the same basic functions—power on/off, volume control—but how they work internally is different.hashtag#Java hashtag#JavaInterface hashtag#InterfaceInJava hashtag#JavaConcepts hashtag#LearnJava hashtag#JavaLearning hashtag#CodingCommunity hashtag#JavaDeveloper hashtag#BackendDevelopment hashtag#SpringBoot hashtag#Microservices hashtag#TechTalk hashtag#TechCommunity hashtag#ProgrammersLife hashtag#CodeNewbie hashtag#WomenWhoCode hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareEngineer hashtag#100DaysOfCode hashtag#CleanCode hashtag#ObjectOrientedProgramming hashtag#JavaBackend hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#API hashtag#DesignPatterns

Requirements: • BS degree or higher in Computer Science or related technical field involving coding. • 14+ years of experience in designing and developing full-stack applications using Java/J2EE, Spring Boot, and React.js. • Strong experience with front-end UI technologies, including JavaScript, React, jQuery, AJAX, JSON, HTML, and CSS. • Strong background in Data Engineering and building data platforms. • Knowledge of messaging systems like Kafka. • A solid understanding of security practices. • Experience in unit and automation testing (Jasmine, Protractor, JUnit). • Experience with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins.Sumit SharmaWhatsapp: +1-971-7080-789Sumit.Sharma@metasisinfo.com

What is an Interface in Java?In Java, an interface is a contract that defines a set of abstract methods. It tells what a class must do, but not how to do it.✅ Helps achieve abstraction ✅ Supports multiple inheritance in Java ✅ Improves loose coupling between componentsReal-world example: Think of an interface as a remote control. Different brands of TVs implement the same basic functions—power on/off, volume control—but how they work internally is different.hashtag#Java hashtag#JavaInterface hashtag#InterfaceInJava hashtag#JavaConcepts hashtag#LearnJava hashtag#JavaLearning hashtag#CodingCommunity hashtag#JavaDeveloper hashtag#BackendDevelopment hashtag#SpringBoot hashtag#Microservices hashtag#TechTalk hashtag#TechCommunity hashtag#ProgrammersLife hashtag#CodeNewbie hashtag#WomenWhoCode hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareEngineer hashtag#100DaysOfCode hashtag#CleanCode hashtag#ObjectOrientedProgramming hashtag#JavaBackend hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#API hashtag#DesignPatterns

What is an Interface in Java?In Java, an interface is a contract that defines a set of abstract methods. It tells what a class must do, but not how to do it.✅ Helps achieve abstraction ✅ Supports multiple inheritance in Java ✅ Improves loose coupling between componentsReal-world example: Think of an interface as a remote control. Different brands of TVs implement the same basic functions—power on/off, volume control—but how they work internally is different.hashtag#Java hashtag#JavaInterface hashtag#InterfaceInJava hashtag#JavaConcepts hashtag#LearnJava hashtag#JavaLearning hashtag#CodingCommunity hashtag#JavaDeveloper hashtag#BackendDevelopment hashtag#SpringBoot hashtag#Microservices hashtag#TechTalk hashtag#TechCommunity hashtag#ProgrammersLife hashtag#CodeNewbie hashtag#WomenWhoCode hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareEngineer hashtag#100DaysOfCode hashtag#CleanCode hashtag#ObjectOrientedProgramming hashtag#JavaBackend hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#API hashtag#DesignPatterns

What is an Interface in Java?In Java, an interface is a contract that defines a set of abstract methods. It tells what a class must do, but not how to do it.✅ Helps achieve abstraction ✅ Supports multiple inheritance in Java ✅ Improves loose coupling between componentsReal-world example: Think of an interface as a remote control. What is an Interface in Java?In Java, an interface is a contract that defines a set of abstract methods. It tells what a class must do, but not how to do it.✅ Helps achieve abstraction ✅ Supports multiple inheritance in Java ✅ Improves loose coupling between componentsReal-world example: Think of an interface as a remote control. What is an Interface in Java?In Java, an interface is a contract that defines a set of abstract methods. It tells what a class must do, but not how to do it.✅ Helps achieve abstraction ✅ Supports multiple inheritance in Java ✅ Improves loose coupling between componentsReal-world example: Think of an interface as a remote control. Different brands of TVs implement the same basic functions—power on/off, volume control—but how they work internally is different.hashtag#Java hashtag#JavaInterface hashtag#InterfaceInJava hashtag#JavaConcepts hashtag#LearnJava hashtag#JavaLearning hashtag#CodingCommunity hashtag#JavaDeveloper hashtag#BackendDevelopment hashtag#SpringBoot hashtag#Microservices hashtag#TechTalk hashtag#TechCommunity hashtag#ProgrammersLife hashtag#CodeNewbie hashtag#WomenWhoCode hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareEngineer hashtag#100DaysOfCode hashtag#CleanCode hashtag#ObjectOrientedProgramming hashtag#JavaBackend hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#API hashtag#DesignPatterns

What is an Interface in Java?In Java, an interface is a contract that defines a set of abstract methods. It tells what a class must do, but not how to do it.✅ Helps achieve abstraction ✅ Supports multiple inheritance in Java ✅ Improves loose coupling between componentsReal-world example: Think of an interface as a remote control. What is an Interface in Java?In Java, an interface is a contract that defines a set of abstract methods. It tells what a class must do, but not how to do it.✅ Helps achieve abstraction ✅ Supports multiple inheritance in Java ✅ Improves loose coupling between componentsReal-world example: Think of an interface as a remote control. Different brands of TVs implement the same basic functions—power on/off, volume control—but how they work internally is different.hashtag#Java hashtag#JavaInterface hashtag#InterfaceInJava hashtag#JavaConcepts hashtag#LearnJava hashtag#JavaLearning hashtag#CodingCommunity hashtag#JavaDeveloper hashtag#BackendDevelopment hashtag#SpringBoot hashtag#Microservices hashtag#TechTalk hashtag#TechCommunity hashtag#ProgrammersLife hashtag#CodeNewbie hashtag#WomenWhoCode hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareEngineer hashtag#100DaysOfCode hashtag#CleanCode hashtag#ObjectOrientedProgramming hashtag#JavaBackend hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#API hashtag#DesignPatterns

What is an Interface in Java?In Java, an interface is a contract that defines a set of abstract methods. It tells what a class must do, but not how to do it.✅ Helps achieve abstraction ✅ Supports multiple inheritance in Java ✅ Improves loose coupling between componentsReal-world example: Think of an interface as a remote control. Different brands of TVs implement the same basic functions—power on/off, volume control—but how they work internally is different.hashtag#Java hashtag#JavaInterface hashtag#InterfaceInJava hashtag#JavaConcepts hashtag#LearnJava hashtag#JavaLearning hashtag#CodingCommunity hashtag#JavaDeveloper hashtag#BackendDevelopment hashtag#SpringBoot hashtag#Microservices hashtag#TechTalk hashtag#TechCommunity hashtag#ProgrammersLife hashtag#CodeNewbie hashtag#WomenWhoCode hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareEngineer hashtag#100DaysOfCode hashtag#CleanCode hashtag#ObjectOrientedProgramming hashtag#JavaBackend hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#API hashtag#DesignPatterns

What is an Interface in Java?In Java, an interface is a contract that defines a set of abstract methods. It tells what a class must do, but not how to do it.✅ Helps achieve abstraction ✅ Supports multiple inheritance in Java ✅ Improves loose coupling between componentsReal-world example: Think of an interface as a remote control. What is an Interface in Java?In Java, an interface is a contract that defines a set of abstract methods. It tells what a class must do, but not how to do it.✅ Helps achieve abstraction ✅ Supports multiple inheritance in Java ✅ Improves loose coupling between componentsReal-world example: Think of an interface as a remote control. Different brands of TVs implement the same basic functions—power on/off, volume control—but how they work internally is different.hashtag#Java hashtag#JavaInterface hashtag#InterfaceInJava hashtag#JavaConcepts hashtag#LearnJava hashtag#JavaLearning hashtag#CodingCommunity hashtag#JavaDeveloper hashtag#BackendDevelopment hashtag#SpringBoot hashtag#Microservices hashtag#TechTalk hashtag#TechCommunity hashtag#ProgrammersLife hashtag#CodeNewbie hashtag#WomenWhoCode hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareEngineer hashtag#100DaysOfCode hashtag#CleanCode hashtag#ObjectOrientedProgramming hashtag#JavaBackend hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#API hashtag#DesignPatterns

Role: Java Developer Location: RemoteDuration: Long Term ContractJob Description:Client is looking for Java Senior Engineer to build end to end business solutions and to work with one of the leading financial services organizations in the US. The candidate must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with domain experts and technical experts in the team. The candidate must have experience in analysis, design, development, maintenance, and support activities. Responsibilities: • Review technology requirements and business processes; code, test, debug, and implement software solutions. • Provide engineering support in the conceptualization, development, implementation, and automation of technical capabilities and products. • Write and implement efficient, maintainable code across both front-end and back-end technologies. • Perform peer reviews on source code to ensure reuse, scalability, and the use of best practices. • Participate in collaborative technical discussions focusing on software user experience, design, architecture, and development. • Perform demonstrations for client stakeholders on project features and sub-features, utilizing the latest front-end and back-end development technologies. • Provide production support, troubleshoot production issues, analyze the root cause of the issues, and implement fixes. • Analyze user needs and software requirements to determine feasibility of design within time and cost constraints. • Confer with other systems analysts, engineers, programmers, and others to design systems and obtain information on project limitations and capabilities, performance requirements, and interfaces. • Store, retrieve, and manipulate data for analysis of system capabilities and requirements. • Conduct technical reviews with other programmers, technologists, technicians, and other engineering and scientific personnel. • Coordinate software system installation and monitor equipment functioning to ensure specifications are met. • Consult with customers about software system design and maintenance.• Report any issues to client stakeholders and UST leadership. Requirements: • BS degree or higher in Computer Science or related technical field involving coding. • 14+ years of experience in designing and developing full-stack applications using Java/J2EE, Spring Boot, and React.js. • Strong experience with front-end UI technologies, including JavaScript, React, jQuery, AJAX, JSON, HTML, and CSS. • Strong background in Data Engineering and building data platforms. • Knowledge of messaging systems like Kafka. • A solid understanding of security practices. • Experience in unit and automation testing (Jasmine, Protractor, JUnit). • Experience with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins.Sumit SharmaWhatsapp: +1-971-7080-789Sumit.Sharma@metasisinfo.com

Recent Interview Experience – Round 1🧠 Coding Rounds:Intersection of Two Linked Lists ➤ Given two singly linked lists, return the node where they intersect (or null if no intersection). ➤ Focus: Linked list traversal, memory-efficient solution using two-pointer technique.Search in Rotated Sorted Array ➤ Find a given element in a rotated sorted array without knowing the rotation count. ➤ Expected Time Complexity: O(log n) ➤ Focus: Modified binary search with pivot detection.☕ Java Core + Conceptual Questions:What is String Constant Pool? ➤ How JVM manages memory for String literals.Why is String immutable in Java? ➤ Thread safety, classloader behavior, and memory efficiency reasons.What is Hashing? ➤ Concept explanation and usage in collections like HashMap, HashSet.Hashtable – Internal Functionality & Performance ➤ Thread-safe but uses synchronized methods, hence slower than ConcurrentHashMap.What are Daemon Threads? ➤ Background threads that do not prevent JVM from exiting.How Threads Work? ➤ Code + Data sharing between threads, stack and heap level understanding.Describe Your Current Project ➤ Role, architecture, technologies, and key contributions.Future vs CompletableFuture ➤ Differences in async handling. ➤ Can use ExecutorService with CompletableFuture using .supplyAsync() or .runAsync().HTTP Methods – Idempotent vs Safe ➤ GET, HEAD, PUT, DELETE are idempotent. ➤ GET, HEAD are safe. ➤ REST vs SOAP comparison: lightweight, stateless vs contract-driven protocol.Maven Commands ➤ mvn package: Creates JAR in /target ➤ mvn install: Installs JAR to local repo ➤ Difference between local and remote repositories explained.📌 A well-rounded interview testing both problem-solving and deep Java internals.hashtag#java hashtag#multithreading hashtag#interview hashtag#growth hashtag#learning hashtag#restapi hashtag#maven hashtag#completablefuture hashtag#datastructures hashtag#javadeveloper hashtag#softwareengineer

What is an Interface in Java?In Java, an interface is a contract that defines a set of abstract methods. It tells what a class must do, but not how to do it.✅ Helps achieve abstraction ✅ Supports multiple inheritance in Java ✅ Improves loose coupling between componentsReal-world example: Think of an interface as a remote control. Different brands of TVs implement the same basic functions—power on/off, volume control—but how they work internally is different.hashtag#Java hashtag#JavaInterface hashtag#InterfaceInJava hashtag#JavaConcepts hashtag#LearnJava hashtag#JavaLearning hashtag#CodingCommunity hashtag#JavaDeveloper hashtag#BackendDevelopment hashtag#SpringBoot hashtag#Microservices hashtag#TechTalk hashtag#TechCommunity hashtag#ProgrammersLife hashtag#CodeNewbie hashtag#WomenWhoCode hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#SoftwareEngineer hashtag#100DaysOfCode hashtag#CleanCode hashtag#ObjectOrientedProgramming hashtag#JavaBackend hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#API hashtag#DesignPatterns

Recent Interview Experience – Round 1🧠 Coding Rounds:Intersection of Two Linked Lists ➤ Given two singly linked lists, return the node where they intersect (or null if no intersection). ➤ Focus: Linked list traversal, memory-efficient solution using two-pointer technique.Search in Rotated Sorted Array ➤ Find a given element in a rotated sorted array without knowing the rotation count. ➤ Expected Time Complexity: O(log n) ➤ Focus: Modified binary search with pivot detection.☕ Java Core + Conceptual Questions:What is String Constant Pool? ➤ How JVM manages memory for String literals.Why is String immutable in Java? ➤ Thread safety, classloader behavior, and memory efficiency reasons.What is Hashing? ➤ Concept explanation and usage in collections like HashMap, HashSet.Hashtable – Internal Functionality & Performance ➤ Thread-safe but uses synchronized methods, hence slower than ConcurrentHashMap.What are Daemon Threads? ➤ Background threads that do not prevent JVM from exiting.How Threads Work? ➤ Code + Data sharing between threads, stack and heap level understanding.Describe Your Current Project ➤ Role, architecture, technologies, and key contributions.Future vs CompletableFuture ➤ Differences in async handling. ➤ Can use ExecutorService with CompletableFuture using .supplyAsync() or .runAsync().HTTP Methods – Idempotent vs Safe ➤ GET, HEAD, PUT, DELETE are idempotent. ➤ GET, HEAD are safe. ➤ REST vs SOAP comparison: lightweight, stateless vs contract-driven protocol.Maven Commands ➤ mvn package: Creates JAR in /target ➤ mvn install: Installs JAR to local repo ➤ Difference between local and remote repositories explained.📌 A well-rounded interview testing both problem-solving and deep Java internals.hashtag#java hashtag#multithreading hashtag#interview hashtag#growth hashtag#learning hashtag#restapi hashtag#maven hashtag#completablefuture hashtag#datastructures hashtag#javadeveloper hashtag#softwareengineer

utilizing Eclipse plugins to enhance automation script development and maintenance.* Proficient in utilizing Eclipse IDE for developing and executing automation scripts using Selenium.* Capable of scripts to facilitate application integration using server-side languages like Shell or Python.* Proficient in reviewing business requirements and system specifications to plan test scope.* Experienced in developing, configuring, and maintaining automated test scripts and environments.* Capable of designing and developing automation scripts for regression testing.* Knowledgeable in SDLC and adept at implementing incremental automation test scripts within Agile team cadence.* Proficient in logging defects, creating defect reports, and ensuring defects correction.if anyone interested
